newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU Commission announces fish price proposal.
newsitem.headline: EU Commission announces fish price proposal.

text.p: The European Commission said on Wednesday it had forwarded to the Council of Ministers its annual proposal for fixing guide prices for fishery products in 1997.

The proposal covers fresh and chilled products as well as frozen products and tuna prices to the canning industry and is based on a comparison of average prices between 1994 and the first half of 1996 compared with the period between 1993 and 1995.

The price decline seen over recent years for whitefish such as cod, haddock, redfish, coalfish, hake and whiting seems to have slowed this year with the exception of cod, the Commission said in a statement.
Prices for pelagic fish (sardines, herrings, mackerel, anchovies and other similar fish) are going up because of cuts in production.
Price trends for frozen products have been favourable for most products except squid (loligo patagonica) and hake.
For tuna for canning the statement said there has been a marked decline in prices in the past six months.
